keyMoments.description: First appearance in the anime, mysteriously appearing on the Going Merry and introducing herself as Miss All Sunday, vice president of Baroque Works.
keyMoments.significance: The debut of one of the most important characters in One Piece who will eventually become the seventh Straw Hat crew member.

keyMoments.description: Reveals that she destroyed Igaram's ship and deliberately allowed Vivi to discover Mr. 0's identity.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes her as a dangerous and enigmatic antagonist with unclear motivations.

keyMoments.description: Demonstrates her Hana Hana no Mi powers by effortlessly flipping Sanji and Usopp using sprouted arms.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of Robin's Devil Fruit abilities in the anime, showcasing the unique and versatile nature of her powers.

keyMoments.description: Departs peacefully from the Going Merry after Luffy destroys the Eternal Pose, leaving with cryptic remarks about meeting again.
keyMoments.significance: Hints at Robin's complex character and suggests she has her own hidden agenda beyond serving Baroque Works.

reveals.content: Revealed as Miss All Sunday, vice president of Baroque Works and partner to Mr. 0 (Crocodile).
Possesses the Hana Hana no Mi (Flower-Flower Fruit), allowing her to sprout body parts from any surface.
High-ranking member of Baroque Works, serving as vice president.

abilities.name: Dos Fleur
abilities.description: Sprouts two arms from a target's body to manipulate or attack them.

relationships.description: Serves as the partner and vice president to Mr. 0 (Crocodile) in Baroque Works.
Luffy rejects her help and declares his hatred for her due to destroying Igaram's ship.
Robin is an enemy of Vivi as a high-ranking member of the organization trying to destroy Arabasta.

keyMoments.description: Destroys the Eternal Pose offered by Miss All Sunday, declaring that no one else has the right to decide where his crew goes.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most iconic character-defining moments in One Piece, establishing Luffy's core values of freedom and self-determination that will guide him throughout the entire series.

relationships.description: Luffy rejects Robin's help and expresses hatred for her due to her role in destroying Igaram's ship.

keyMoments.description: Witnesses Igaram's ship explode in a massive fireball, believing her loyal guardian has been killed.
keyMoments.significance: A traumatic moment that reinforces the deadly stakes of her mission to save Arabasta and the sacrifices being made on her behalf.

keyMoments.description: Receives the Eternal Pose from Miss All Sunday, momentarily considering taking the safer route to Arabasta.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Vivi's desperation to save her kingdom and her willingness to accept help even from an enemy, before Luffy intervenes.

keyMoments.description: Disguises himself as Princess Vivi and sets sail as a decoy to draw Baroque Works' attention away from the real Vivi.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates his unwavering loyalty and willingness to sacrifice himself for the princess he has served since childhood.

keyMoments.description: His ship is destroyed in a massive explosion shortly after leaving Whisky Peak, apparently killing him.
keyMoments.significance: A shocking apparent death that establishes the lethal stakes of opposing Baroque Works. Later revealed to be a fake-out as Igaram survived.

keyMoments.description: In the only instance in the series, Sanji points his gun at Miss All Sunday and threatens to harm her to protect Vivi.
keyMoments.significance: A character-defining moment that shows Sanji's loyalty to his crewmates can override even his strongest principle of never harming women. Demonstrates the extreme tension and danger of the situation.
